title: Premier League champions Leicester pushing to seal deal for non-league hotshot Josh Gordon
text:
Gordon (centre) is on Leicester's radar (Photo: Daily Post Wales) Share Get football     
Leicester are pushing to tie up a deal for non-league hotshot Josh Gordon. 
The Foxes are ready to offer Gordon a dream move to the Premier League after he impressed on trial last week. 
But they won't have a clear run with a number of Championship and League One clubs having also entered the race to land the 22 year-old forward. 
Gordon caught Leicester's eye after bagging 10 goals in just 16 starts for Evo-Stik Premier Division side Stafford Rangers. Craig Shakespeare is currently in caretaker charge of Leicester   Vardy fired Leicester to victory over Liverpool on Monday   
And he enhanced his claims during his trial when he trained with the first team, under 23s and played for their second string against Nottingham Forest last Friday. 
Leicester saw enough to convince them Gordon has what it takes to eventually feature for the first team and are now in talks over a deal. 
The Foxes are no strangers to a non-league raid having signed Jamie Vardy from Fleetwood for Â£1m in 2012.
